title: Grilled Mushroom Swiss Burgers Recipe
description: This beefy mushroom Swiss burger is a delicious combo of grilled beef, savory sliced mushrooms, and Swiss cheese served in a hamburger bun.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Main Dishes Burger Recipes Hamburgers Grilled Mushroom Swiss Burgers 4.3 (55) 34 Reviews 10 Photos This beefy mushroom Swiss burger recipe is too good not to try! It's a great way to spice up an ordinary hamburger. Not only can this be done on the grill, but you can also pan-fry the burgers if preferred. Submitted by Ms Stephanie Updated on November 21, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 10 10 10 10 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Total Time: 30 mins Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 1 ½ pounds lean ground beef ½ teaspoon seasoned meat tenderizer salt and pepper to taste 2 teaspoons butter 2 (4 ounce) cans sliced mushrooms, drained 2 tablespoons soy sauce 4 slices Swiss cheese 6 hamburger buns Directions Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat and lightly oil the grate. Divide ground beef into 6 equal-sized patties; season with meat tenderizer, salt, and pepper. Set aside. Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add mushrooms and soy sauce; cook and stir until browned. Set aside and keep warm. Grill patties on the preheated grill until cooked through, about 6 minutes per side. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees C). Spoon mushroom mixture evenly on top of patties on the grill; top each one with a slice of Swiss cheese. Cover the grill until cheese melts, about 1 minute. Remove patties from the grill and serve on hamburger buns. I Made It Print 122 home cooks made it! Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. Add Your Photo Photos of Grilled Mushroom Swiss Burgers 01 of 10 Photo by  Baking Nana 02 of 10 Photo by  Tatiana Obergin 07/04/2020 03 of 10 Photo by  Sherry Leek Beuckelaere 05/02/2018 Only change was I used dehydrated onion and about 2 Tbsp. Worcestershir sauce and ground black pepper. Just not ctazy for burgers. 04 of 10 Photo by  AllrecipesPhoto 09/12/2017 05 of 10 Photo by  Chelsea Louise Swayer 08/10/2016 06 of 10 Photo by  Alex Pangestu 04/12/2015 07 of 10 Photo by  RoxRod 05/26/2014 08 of 10 Photo by  Sherri 05/23/2014 We grilled the burgers, didn't have meat tenderizer, so just used the salt and pepper. Also used fresh mushrooms and sauteed them in a cast iron pan over the grill. Set aside and keep warm.;Grill patties on the preheated grill until cooked through, about 6 minutes per side. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees C).;Spoon mushroom mixture evenly on top of patties on the grill; top each one with a slice of Swiss cheese. Cover the grill until cheese melts, about 1 minute. Remove patties from the grill and serve on hamburger buns.
